channel.title: Blogs on Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Portfolio

item.title: Python-R interaction
item.description: Blogpost 1 One of the most interesting topics to me was the interaction between R and Python. It is amazing that we can run Python code in R. In this blog post I will be showing how that can be possible. Usually in R markdown, when we try to run a code, we create a code chunk which can be done by adding three backticks followed by curly brakets containing the letter R; like this (```{R}).
